subsection.name: Customizing RSS Feed Creator for your environment
subsection.p: RSS Feed Creator is easily customized for your own environment. The most common customization will be using your own document type in the RSS feed instead of the provided example. You might also want to customize the JSP that generated the actual RSS XML.

subsection.name: Using your own document type
subsection.p: To use your own document type in an RSS feed, check the following:

li.p: Make sure your document type has title, date and description fields. You can give the fields any name you want, they will be mapped later to bean properties.
Enter the full JCR node type name (e.g. "myproject:mydoctype") of your document type in the "Document Type" field of your RSS feed descriptor document.

Create a Java bean for your document type. You probably already have it if you are building an HST2 website. Check out SampleRSSItem.java for an example. It is best to have getTitle(), getDate() and getDescription() methods, so you won't have to change the RSSFeedBuilder HST component class. But if you really want you can use other method names to get your title, date and description fields.

The RSSFeedBuilder HST components currently has a limitation: it has the name of the date field hardcoded in its search filter (see bug #29). Open RSSFeedBuilder.java and replace "rss:date" with the full JCR property name of your document type's date field.

subsection.name: Customizing the RSS XML
subsection.p: If you want to modify the actual RSS XML, edit the file rss.jsp in your site module.
